query: How Brand Budget Owners Evaluate Local Partnerships

confidence.note: Directional evidence: 9 sources • 7 domains • 9 in-window / 0 background • support coverage 67%

title: How Brand Budget Owners Evaluate Local Partnerships
highlights: Front-load exclusive in-store drops in the Nov 29–Dec 13 window to avoid Cyber Monday price pressure and raise early-window buyer share.
Treat stores as studios: capture owned content to lower paid CPM while measuring buyer activity share versus promo intensity daily.
Co-funded, limited offers plus QR tracking hold event CPA down and provide attribution if QR redemption reaches **≥5%** of footfall.
executive_summary: You need to capture high-value holiday buyers with local partnerships between Nov 29 and Dec 13 without turning every activation into a headline discount race. This matters because front-loaded, collab-led activations can lift foot traffic from a base **10–15%** toward a stretch of **≥25%**, increase early-window share from **12–15%** to **20–30%**, and keep event CPA at or below **0.80× baseline** when discount depth is controlled [^7][^2]. Over the next 30 days, launch a **20‐store** Nov 29–Dec 13 exclusive drop with one brand partner owned by Head of Retail and Head of Partnerships, and measure early-window share, event CPA and QR redemption against matched controls daily to decide scale and spend.
top_operator_moves: Run a 20‐store exclusive in-store drop Nov 29–Dec 13 with one brand partner; set the KPI: early-window share **20–30%** and lock assortment to high-margin SKUs.
Deploy QR-tagged offers and content in every pilot store and instrument QR redemption against footfall, aiming for **≥5%** redemption to validate in-store attribution.
Produce three store-as-studio shoots in high-traffic pilot stores, report buyer activity share vs promo intensity daily, and withhold paid amplification until organic signals meet thresholds.

scope.topic: How Brand Budget Owners Evaluate Local Partnerships

unified_target_pack.paired_metric: Track buyer activity share vs promo intensity side by side

scope.operator_job_story: You need to capture high-value holiday buyers with local partnerships between Nov 29 and Dec 13 without turning every activation into a headline discount race.
search_shaped_variants: How do we shift store events earlier in the holiday calendar to avoid Cyber Monday price pressure?
Which local partner activations lift foot traffic without increasing markdown depth?
Test plan: exclusive drops in stores Nov 29–Dec 13 — what metrics and cadence do we measure?
What QR or content measures prove attribution for brand↔brand in-store activations?
scope.evidence_note: Directional evidence: 9 sources • 7 domains • 9 in-window / 0 background • support coverage 67%

pilot_spec.primary_move: Run a two-week exclusive in-store drop with one brand partner across 20 curated pilot stores to raise early-window buyer share while enforcing CPA and redemption guardrails.

foot_traffic_uplift.label: Foot traffic uplift vs baseline
foot_traffic_uplift.target_text: Increase foot traffic by 10-15% vs baseline, with a stretch goal of 625%.

early_window_share.label: Early-window buyer share (first 2 weeks)
early_window_share.target_text: Raise early-window buyer share to 20-30% of total period buyers (current ~12-15%).

event_cpa.label: Event cost per acquisition vs baseline
event_cpa.target_text: Keep event CPA at or below 0.8x baseline (ceiling guardrail).

qr_redemption.label: QR/code redemption rate per footfall
qr_redemption.target_text: Achieve at least 5% QR redemptions of footfall (activation-level pause recommended if redemptions fall below ~15%).

role_actions.Head of Retail: Execute the Nov 29 Dec 13 pilot across 20 curated stores, own Foot traffic measurement and store ops, and pause any store where Event CPA > 0.8x baseline or QR redemption < 15% this window.
role_actions.Head of Partnerships: Lock partner assortment, co-funding terms, and in-store creative for the two-week exclusive drop and own Early-window share and QR redemption targets during the pilot.
role_actions.Head of Marketing: Run front-of-store media, schedule three store-as-studio shoots in high-traffic pilot stores, and measure buyer activity share versus promo intensity daily to inform pacing.
role_actions.Finance: Set and enforce the Event CPA guardrail at 0.8x baseline for the pilot, pre-approve co-funding thresholds, and stop funding if CPA guardrail is breached.
